description:
Spain enforces measures in relation to places of worship and
civil and religious ceremonies as part of the declaration of the state of emergency on March 14 - people attending any ceremony, including funerals, should avoid crowds of people and ensure a distance of at least one metre. The updated rules have been changed on May 3 in Formentera, la Gomera, el Hierro and la Graciosa. The former still apply to the rest of Spain. UPDATE: The previous rules for places of worship, vigils and funerals have been changed on May 3 in Formentera, la Gomera, el Hierro and la Graciosa. The former still apply to the rest of Spain.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description: From 4 May 2020, all establishments and commercial premises of less than 400 square meters in area that had to lower their shutters on 14 March, following the publication of Royal Decree 463/2020, can be reopened to the public. declaring the state of alarm for the management of the situation of the sanitary crisis of the Covid-19. except for those with an area of ​​more than 400 meterssquares, as well as those that have the character of a shopping center or park commercial, or that are within them without direct and independent access from the outside.

description: "On Sunday (May 3, 2020), Spain’s Official State Gazette (BOE) published five ministerial orders setting out new measures that go into effect on Monday, May 4, 2020." Extremadura, Spain is adopting these orders. "Until now, restaurants have been allowed home delivery. Starting on Monday (May 4, 2020), customers may also pick up their orders at the restaurant, as long as safety conditions are met. There must be a plexiglass barrier separating workers from clients, and ideally only one employee per client. When this is not possible, the latter will have to remain two meters apart. Hand sanitizer must be available at the entrance and exit, as well as trash cans without lids that have to be lifted by hand. Orders must be placed ahead of time by phone or online to avoid crowds."
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Restaurants
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
target_who_gen: Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry),Other population not specifed above

description: Spain announces on May 3 that starting from May 4 in regular public transport in which all occupants must travel seated, no more than half of the available seats may be occupied. In any case, in the buses the row after the seat occupied by the driver will always be kept empty. In collective public transport of urban and peri-urban travelers (metro, line buses), where there are platforms enabled for the transport of standing passengers, the reference will be the occupation of half of the seats seated and a maximum of two travelers standing per square meter.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Spain announces on May 3 that starting from May 4, in private and complementary private transport (company vehicles whose main activity is not the transport of goods, such as a transport truck from a brewery) of up to nine seats, including the driver, for each row of seats, two people are allowed to be on board, provided they use masks and respect the maximum possible distance between the occupants.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart

description:
On May 11, all of Andalucia, except for Málaga and Granada, transition to Phase 1 of Spains deescalation plan. Due to this transition, many previous restrictions on businesses from Spains national lockdown are lifted. 

Under this new phase, the "[g]eneral opening of commercial businesses that are not part of a shopping centre" is allowed, "with 30 percent of normal clientele allowed at any time, practising social distancing with at least 2 metres between clients and with a timetable that gives preference to those over age 65." Additionally, open-air markets are allowed to reopen, but have "to have a limit of 25 percent of their previous capacity of stalls in order to assure distance between them" ("or all of the stalls can remain as long as the area of the market itself is made larger").

Furthermore, "[r]estaurants, bars and cafés can open their outside terraces at 50% capacity," and "[h]otels can open, but all of their common areas must remain closed."
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Retail Businesses
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
target_who_gen: Non-essential workers (please note their occupation in the text entry where applicable)

description: On May 18, The Valencian Community enters Phase 1 of Spain’s 4-phase de escalation plan. Under this new phase, the general opening of commercial businesses that are not part of a shopping centre is allowed, with 30% of normal clientele allowed at any time, practising social distancing with at least 2 metres between clients and with a timetable that gives preference to those over age 65. Additionally, open-air markets are allowed to reopen, but have to have a limit of 25% of their previous capacity of stalls in order to assure distance between them.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)

target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

UPDATE: On May 25, all of Andalucia, except for Málaga and Granada, transition to Phase 2 of Spains deescalation plan. description:
From May 20,2020, the Department of Education has prepared an opening plan for educational centers in Catalonia for the end of the current academic year and for the next academic year 2020-2021.
Regarding the dates of application of the plan in each center, they must be adapted to the progressiveness of the arrival of Phase 2 in each territory. 
-Nurseries, maximum 5 students per classroom. 
-Kindergarten and primary schools, maximum 13 students per group.
-ESO centers and post-compulsory education, in groups of 15 students maximum.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)

description: On May 25, all of Andalucia, except for Málaga and Granada, transition to Phase 2 of Spains deescalation plan. Due to this transition, many more previous restrictions on businesses from Spains national lockdown are lifted. Under this new phase, bars and restaurants are now also allowed to open their interior "as long as occupancy is capped at 40 percent and people are grouped around tables 2 metres apart from other customers." Additionally, "shopping malls and large premises will be able to welcome customers," with conditions being " that premises must limit the capacity to 30 percent in common areas of shopping malls and 40 percent to within the stores themselves," with social distancing being respected at all times. Finally, "[c]ommunal areas in hotels and other tourist accommodation can open to 1/3 of capacity."
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Restaurants
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
target_who_gen: Non-essential workers (please note their occupation in the text entry where applicable)

description:
On May 25, all of Andalucia, except for Málaga and Granada, transition to Phase 1 of Spains deescalation plan. Due to this transition, many more previous restrictions on businesses from Spains national lockdown are lifted. Under this new phase, bars and restaurants are now also allowed to open their interior "as long as occupancy is capped at 40 percent and people are grouped around tables 2 metres apart from other customers." Additionally, "shopping malls and large premises will be able to welcome customers," with conditions being " that premises must limit the capacity to 30 percent in common areas of shopping malls and 40 percent to within the stores themselves," with social distancing being respected at all times. Finally, "[c]ommunal areas in hotels and other tourist accommodation can open to 1/3 of capacity."

description: On June 8, all of Andalucia transitions to Phase 3 of Spains deescalation plan. Due to this transition, many more previous restrictions on businesses from Spains national lockdown are lifted. Under this new phase, the "occupancy on a terrace of a bar or restaurant rises from 50 percent in Phase 2 to 75 percent in Phase 3."Additionally, "Restaurants and cafes can open their indoor seating areas, with table service only [,]... numbers limited to" around half capacity, "hand sanitizer at the door," and    the preservation of social distancing. Furthermore, "nightclubs will be able to open, again at a maximum of a third of their usual capacity." On top of these loosened restrictions, "shops will be able to increase their capacity to up to 50%," and "Cinemas, theatres, shows, [and] concerts can all open" with limited capacity. Finally, "Hotels can now open their common areas including spas for up to 50 percent usual capacity," "Amusement parks, zoos, aquariums and that sort of thing can" open with limited capacity varying if visitors are inside or outside, and "Casinos, gaming halls and betting shops can open with a reduced capacity of 50 percent and maximum of 50 people."
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Restaurants
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Bars

description:
On June 8, all of Andalucia transitions to Phase 3 of Spains deescalation plan. Due to this transition, many more previous restrictions on government services from Spains national lockdown are lifted:

- "Libraries may be used (both for cultural activities and for study), provided that they do not exceed 50% of their capacity and that they comply with all the other measures established in the Order."

- "Museums may allow the public to visit their collections and temporary exhibitions, as well as to participate in cultural or educational activities, as long as they do not exceed 50% of the museum's capacity and the groups do not exceed 20 people, among other restrictions."
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Public libraries
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On June 8, The Castilla and Leon Community enters Phase 2 of Spain de-escalation plan. Due to this, kids up to six years old could go to the education center with a maximum level of 33% of its total capacity. Students of last academic years could go to the education center only if they want, but respecting a maximum capacity of 15 people. Open-air spaces should be available for children. Mask wearing and keeping a 2 metres distance between children are required. Therefore, all educational updates within the de-escalation period will be coded sub nationally.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

Cinemas and theaters can now open at 30% of their total capacity

description: On June 11, the Spanish Ministries of Health and Education and Professional Training release a document, agreed upon by the autonomous communities, that declares a strategy "to offer a safe and healthy environment for students and staff of educational centers in order to resume face-to-face activity for the 2020-2021 academic year that begins in September." This strategy fundamentally revolves around "contact limitation, personal prevention measures, case management, and cleaning and ventilation."
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education,Provincial/State Government

description: On June 15, The Valencian Community enters Phase 3 of Spain’s 4-phase de escalation plan. Under this new phase, open-air markets are allowed with 75% of normal stands. Terraces can operate at 75% capacity. Standing in bars is also permitted but with a distance of 1.5m between customers.  Furthermore, shopping centres can open again with a capacity limited to 75% within shops and 75% in communal areas. All other establishments that had been allowed to open with a third capacity during the previous phases are now able to increase to 50% capacity.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Bars
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On June 15, The Valencian Community enters Phase 3 of Spain’s 4-phase de escalation plan. Due to this transition, some previous limitations on businesses are lifted. Nightclubs and music bars can open and operate at 30% capacity. Dancing is not permitted, however, when there is an area used for a dance-floor or similar in a venue, it should be used to install tables or groups of tables, and cannot be employed for its habitual use.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Bars
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On June 15, The Valencian Community enters Phase 3 of Spain’s 4-phase de escalation plan. Due to this transition, some previous limitations on government services are lifted. Museums and libraries can now open at 75% of capacity. Also, people can gather at beaches in groups of up to 20 people. Finally, parks’ playgrounds for kids re-open.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Parks
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On June 15, five provinces of The Castilla y Leon Community (Valladolid, Palencia, Burgos, Zamora y Leon) enters Phase 3 of Spain’s 4-phase de-escalation plan. Due to this transition, some previous limitations on government services are lifted. Museums, cinemas and libraries can now open at 50% of their total capacity. Also, parks’ playgrounds for kids re-open with a maximum capacity of 50%.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
On June 15, five provinces of The Castilla y Leon Community (Valladolid, Palencia, Burgos, Zamora y Leon) enters Phase 3 of Spain’s 4-phase de-escalation plan. Due to this transition, some previous limitations on government services are lifted. Museums, cinemas and libraries can now open at 50% of their total capacity. Also, parks’ playgrounds for kids re-open with a maximum capacity of 50%.

 UPDATE: On June 21, The Castilla y Leon Community finished Spain’s 4-phase de-escalation plan and all the nine provinces entered the “New Normal” phase.

description: Ximo Puig, president of Generalitat Valenciana, informed that on July 19, schools of the Valencian Community for kids up to 3 years old (i.e. preschool, kindergarten), whether public or private, can reopen and resume their activity. Also, summer schools can open with 75% of the normal student number (maximum capacity is 100 in closed spaces and 250 in opened ones). Additionally, elementary, middle and high schools must provide face-to-face tutoring to families by appointment. Also, they can carry out face-to-face activities in small groups for students who take the university entrance exams. Finally, university students can resume their internships.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On June 21, The Castilla y Leon Community finishes Spain’s 4-phase de-escalation plan and enters the “new normal” phase. Due to this transition, some previous limitations on government services are lifted. People can gather at beaches in groups of up to 25 people. Parks’ playgrounds for kids re-open with a maximum capacity of 75% . All the squares, venues and bullfighting facilities will be able to carry out their bullfighting activity as long as they have pre-assigned seats and 75% of the authorized capacity is not exceeded

description: On June 21, The Castilla y Leon Community finishes Spain’s 4-phase de-escalation plan and enters the “new normal” phase.. Under this new phase, the general opening of commercial businesses that are not part of a shopping centre is allowed, with 75% of normal clientele allowed at any time, practising social distancing with at least 1.5 metres between clients. Additionally, open-air markets are allowed to reopen, but have to have a limit of 75% of their previous capacity of stalls in order to assure distance between them.

description: On June 21, The Castilla y Leon Community finishes Spain’s 4-phase de-escalation plan and enters the “new normal” phase. Under this new phase, shops and stores can open independently of their size, but with capacity limited to 75%. Furthermore, shopping centres can open again with a capacity limited to 75% within shops and 50% in communal areas. Museums will open again with a capacity of 75%.Standing in bars are also permitted but with a distance of 1.5m between customers and operating with a limit of 75% of its capacity.

description: On June 21, The Castilla y Leon Community finishes Spain’s 4-phase de-escalation plan and enters the “new normal” phase. Due to this transition, some previous limitations on businesses are lifted. Nightclubs and music bars can now re-open their interior areas, and its capacity is limited to 33%. Dancing is not permitted, however, when there is an area used for a dance-floor or similar in a venue, it should be used to install tables or groups of tables, and cannot be employed for its habitual use.

description:
Castilla and Leon (Spain) - As a part of New Normality Program, singed on June 19 and entered into force on June 21, the general obligation is established, for all citizens, to maintain the interpersonal safety distance of 1.5 meters and the use of a mandatory mask when such separation cannot be guaranteed; It also indicates the need to provide the Health Authority with certain information that contributes to the traceability of COVID-19 cases, all obligations arising from Royal Decree-Law 21/2020.

From July 16, masks need to be used in Castilla and Leon in all public indoor and outdoor areas, regardless of the interpersonal security distance. UPDATE: From July 16, masks need to be used in Castilla and Leon in all public indoor and outdoor areas, regardless of the interpersonal security distance.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: In the Community of Madrid, Spain, libraries, archives, museums, exhibition rooms, and monuments were allowed to operate at 60% capacity through July 5. Starting July 6, they could operate at 75% capacity. Visitor groups must contain no more than 25 people, including the monitor or guide. Multiuse spaces could have an occupancy of up to 20% before July 5, but up to 60% since July 6 with preassigned seats. In outdoor spaces, including bullfighting rings, 60% capacity was allowed until July 5 and 75% since July 6, with preassigned seats. Rings must disinfect seats. Outdoor festivals may resume under sanitary conditions.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: In the Community of Madrid, Spain, passengers over 6 years old must wear masks while using public transportation. On the metro, it is possible to occupy 100% of the seats (benches), except for the one next to the conductor. In residential areas, there can be 2-3 people per seat (bench), but the maximum possible distance should be kept. In private vehicles with over 9 seats, all passengers do not have to be members of the same household. Taxis must heed sanitary guidelines at all times.
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on  private vehicles in public circulation
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: The weekend of July 11, it is announced that, starting July 15, "face masks will be compulsory in all open and closed spaces in Andalucia." The only exceptions to this rule include children "under six years of age," those with a breathing "illness or difficulty," those with a disability/those who are dependent, those running to do sports, and in instances of force majeure. Finally, if on is swimming or "seated 'under the umbrella' in a family unit," they do not need to wear a mask.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On July 16th, 2020, the provincial government of Navarre (Spain) announced that all individuals over the age of 12 must wear masks in outdoor and indoor public spaces, with exceptions for eating and exercising.

description: As of July 16, 2020, the Basque Country is making face masks mandatory in public at all times, regardless of whether a distance of 1.5 meters between people can be observed.

description:
On July 18, Minister of Health of Generalitat Valenciana, Ana Barceló, confirmed that the use of masks will be compulsory throughout all three provinces of the region (Valencia, Alicante and Castellón) in open spaces and in public areas, both indoors and outdoors, the only exceptions being beaches, swimming pools and natural spaces – always when the space allows maintenance of the 1.5 meters social distancing. Also,
Also, Barceló reminded that masks are not demanded for people under the age of 6 or with breathing difficulties.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: In Catalonia from September 14, 2020 During the upcoming school year in Catalonia, face masks will not be necessary in the case of stable groups in the classroom. But they will have to be used when entering and leaving the school, in the corridors and in areas that are shared with other groups and where students can mix, such as the canteen, laboratories and the schoolyard. In the case of teachers who deal with various different groups or classes, they will have to wear masks and maintain social distancing.Both the education and health departments have admitted that the rules may be changed if the situation gets worse, and they are not ruling out establishing the use of masks in classrooms with children aged 10 and over.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education,Provincial/State Government

description: Spanish authorities have announced that parts of the Madrid region are to go into lockdown from Monday, September 21, following an increase in coronavirus disease (COVID-19) cases. The measures are to be in place for two weeks. Face masks and social distancing measures are mandatory in public places throughout Spain.

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
For hotels and catering services: 
1. The closing time of these establishments will be at 00:00 hours, without being able to accept orders from 23:00.
2. The bars may only be used by the people to order and collect their order.
3. The use of a mask is mandatory at all times except at the time of consumption.
4.Strict compliance with ventilation and air conditioning measures in indoor spaces must be carried out.

description:
For tobacco consumption in public:
1. Smoking may not be allowed on public roads, terraces, beaches or other outdoor spaces, when the minimum interpersonal distance of at least 2 meters cannot be respected.
2. This limitation shall also apply to the use of any other tobacco inhalation device, water pipes, hookahs or similar including electronic cigarettes or vaping in outdoor or enclosed spaces.

description:
For gambling places:
The opening of establishments and spaces dedicated to recreational and gambling activities, including gambling casinos, bingo halls, recreational rooms of slot machines, is allowed if the following rules are followed:
1. A minimum of 1.5 meters between chairs of different tables must be ensured. 
2. It will not be possible to exceed 50% of maximum capacity inside the premises. 
3. The occupancy of the tables will be a maximum of 6 people per table indoors and 10 people per table outdoors.
4. They must be closed at 2:00am.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Other Businesses
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
Measures relating to tourist guide activities:
1. This activity will be carried out, preferably, by appointment.
2. The maximum group will be 25 people in outdoor spaces and 15 people in enclosed spaces, including the tour guide.
3. The safety and hygiene measures established in general must be respected, and in particular those relating to the maintenance of the minimum interpersonal safety distance and the use of masks.

description: From July 15, 2021 to July 22, 2021, bars, restaurants, and cafés in Catalonia, Spain will be allowed to open from 6:00am to 12:30am. While there are no restrictions on outdoor dining capacity, only 10 people are allowed to sit with each other unless they live in the same household. Indoor capacity is limited to 50% and only up to six people are permitted to sit with each other. For indoor and outdoor consumption, masks will be enforced when not eating or drinking.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
